result.execSummary:
The defendant Keenan S Cox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Keenan S Cox is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Keenan S Cox was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenan S Cox

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $897.00 entered as ordered by the court on 10/19/15 to pay $25.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 11/01/18. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Received, signed and forwarded to Sandy Cottrill:
Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs.
cab

Defendant Keenan S Cox in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Statement as to sentencing by the state, defense.
As to count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3  days time served. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to pay a fine/forfeiture of $1,000.00 plus costs and surcharges within 9 months, by 06/10/2016.  In lieu of the fine, the court will allow the defendant to perform 100 hours of community service.  Failure to complete the community service or pay the fine will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant's request for a time served sentence and fine, and request not to apply the domestic abuse modifier.

Plea hearing proceeded, same appearances.
As to count 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.   PSI was/not ordered. Case set for sentencing in Branch 36.
 As to count 1:
On motion of the state, court ordered count 1 dismissed.
Jury trial of 08/24/2015 is vacated.

Attorney Christopher Donovan in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a final pretrial today.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued....

Court advised defendant that the offer is revoked. Case remains set for jury trial in Br. 36 on 08/24/2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed By Attorney Chris Donovan, Motions In Limine
Filed By Attorney Chris Donovan, Proposed Jury Instructions
Filed By Attorney Chris Donovan:  Defense Witness List
Signed & Filed, Order for Payment of Private Investigator Costs.
Received & Filed, Cover Letter & Proposed Order.

Defendant Keenan S Cox in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests additional time to conduct investigation.  Court grants request and allows for defense to contract with an investigator.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Motions to be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Keenan S Cox in court, PRO SE.  Owen Piotrowksi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Christopher D. Donovan, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $60.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning the 1st of the month after the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference date in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AUBREE P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Keenan S Cox in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Keenan S Cox in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
